channel.title: Comments on: Our own world tour of The Valley?

item.description: [...] Irish invasion of Silicon Valley has gained quite a bit of momentum in the past few days and today a press release was sent out [...]

item.title: By: Pat Phelan
item.dc:creator: Pat Phelan
item.description: Would love to go, I have good contacts out their and can arrange visits to the large telco concerns
item.content:encoded: Would love to go, I have good contacts out their and can arrange visits to the large telco concerns

item.title: By: Sean O Sullivan
item.dc:creator: Sean O Sullivan
item.description: I was on that same EI trip back in '99. Really excellent - I still recall some of the site visits, and the lectures, from that week. All in favour of a group tour, especially if we could get some Stanford tie-in and/or start-up networking tie-in over there.
item.content:encoded: I was on that same EI trip back in ’99. Really excellent – I still recall some of the site visits, and the lectures, from that week. All in favour of a group tour, especially if we could get some Stanford tie-in and/or start-up networking tie-in over there.

item.title: By: Ben Mosse
item.dc:creator: Ben Mosse
item.description: Conor, give me a ring. I would be happy to discuss how EI could help get involved in putting this together with you.
item.content:encoded: Conor, give me a ring. I would be happy to discuss how EI could help get involved in putting this together with you.

item.title: By: Yann Le Gouic
item.dc:creator: Yann Le Gouic
item.description:
yup great idea ;)
I would be glad to join and help !
item.content:encoded:
yup great idea

item.title: By: fergusburns
item.dc:creator: fergusburns
item.description:
This is a great idea.
Based on what the Israeli group itinerary - it would be great if we could do something similar - surely the Irish "valley" ex-pat community would also get involved.
item.content:encoded:
This is a great idea.

Based on what the Israeli group itinerary – it would be great if we could do something similar – surely the Irish “valley” ex-pat community would also get involved.
